content: Japan's largest stadium with a capacity of 70,000 hosting regular international & J League fixtures.
title: International Stadium Yokohama

content: The stadium is the home of J1 League football club FC Tokyo and J2 League football club Tokyo Verdy and is used as the venue of some lower divisions of football leagues.
title: Tokyo Stadium

content: Showa Denko Dome Oita (昭和電工ドーム大分) is a multi-purpose stadium in the city of Ōita.
title: Oita Stadium

content: Shizuoka Stadium ECOPA (静岡スタジアム・エコパ Shizuoka Sutajiamu Ekopa) is a sports stadium used primarily for football.
title: Shizuoka Stadium Ecopa

content: The Kobe City Misaki Park Stadium (神戸市御崎公園球技場), also known as The Noevir Stadium Kobe (ノエビアスタジアム神戸), is a football stadium in Misaki Park, Hyogo-ku, Kobe, Japan. The stadium has a capacity of 30,132.
title: Kobe Misaki Stadium

content: The Hanazono Rugby Stadium (東大阪市花園ラグビー場, literally "Higashiosaka City Hanazono Rugby Stadium") in Higashiosaka is the oldest dedicated rugby union stadium in Japan.
title: Hanazono Rugby Stadium

content: Toyota Stadium (豊田スタジアム Toyota Sutajiamu) is a 45,000 seat retractable roof stadium in Toyota, Aichi Prefecture, Japan.
title: City of Toyota Stadium

content: Kumagaya Rugby Stadium (熊谷ラグビー場), is a rugby stadium in Kumagaya, Saitama, Japan. It is currently used mostly for rugby union matches.
title: Kumagaya Rugby Stadium

content: Level5 Stadium (レベルファイブスタジアム) (formerly Hakatanomori Football Stadium, renamed on March 1, 2008 for naming rights), located in the Hakata ward of Fukuoka city is the home ground of Avispa Fukuoka association football club.
title: Fukuoka Hakatanomori Stadium

content: Sapporo Dome (札幌ドーム Sapporo Dōmu) is a stadium located in Toyohira-ku, Sapporo, Japan, and is primarily used for baseball and association football.
title: Sapporo Dome

content: Egao Kenko Stadium (えがお健康スタジアム) is a multi-purpose stadium in Higashi-ku, Kumamoto, Japan. It is currently used mostly for football (Roasso Kumamoto) matches and sometimes for Top League rugby games. The stadium holds 32,000 people.
title: Kumamoto Stadium

content: Kamaishi Recovery Memorial Stadium (Japanese: 釜石鵜住居復興スタジアム Hepburn: Kamaishi Unosumai Fukkō Sutajiamu), also known as Kamaishi Unosumai Stadium, is a stadium in Unosumai-cho, Kamaishi, Iwate.
title: Kamaishi Recovery Memorial Stadium

content: Tokyo International Airport (東京国際空港 Tōkyō Kokusai Kūkō), commonly known as Haneda Airport (羽田空港 Haneda Kūkō), Tokyo Haneda Airport, and Haneda International Airport (IATA: HND, ICAO: RJTT), is one of the two primary airports that serve the Greater Tokyo Area.
title: Haneda International Airport

content: This mammoth international airport serving the Tokyo area offers direct rail access to the city.
title: Narita International Airport

content: Serving the greater Osaka area, this hub on a man-made island has rail access & an adjacent hotel.
title: Kansai International Airport

content: This Central Japan airport on an artificial island offers direct rail access & on-site lodging.
title: Chubu Centrair International Airport

content: Regional airport with a runway observation deck, rooftop gardens & direct-rail service to Sannomiya.
title: Kobe Airport
